infotexts.PublicServerToolTip: Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the "Join Server" -tab.
infotexts.AttemptUPnPToolTip: UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions).
infotexts.ApplySettingsQuestion: Do you want to apply the settings or discard the changes?
infotexts.RestartRequiredText: You need to restart the game for the resolution changes to take effect.
infotexts.RoundSummaryGameOver: The ocean has claimed [sub] and its crew.
infotexts.Head: Head
infotexts.DeleteDialogQuestion: Are you sure you want to delete "[file]"?
infotexts.ShuttleWarning: Most shuttles are not adequately equipped to deal with the dangers of the Europan depths. Are you sure you want to choose a shuttle as your vessel?
infotexts.MasterServerTimeOutError: Could not connect to master server (request timed out).
infotexts.MasterServerErrorException: Error while connecting to master server { [error] }
infotexts.MasterServerError404: Error while connecting to master server (404 - [masterserverurl] not found)
infotexts.MasterServerErrorUnavailable: Error while connecting to master server (505 - Service Unavailable). The master server may be down for maintenance or temporarily overloaded. Please try again after in a few moments.
infotexts.MasterServerErrorDefault: Error while connecting to master server ([statuscode]: [statusdescription])
infotexts.SubNotFound: Submarine not found in your submarine folder
infotexts.SubDoesntMatch: Your version of the submarine doesn't match the servers version
infotexts.SubNotFoundError: Submarine [subname] was selected by the server. Matching file not found in your submarine folder.
infotexts.SubLoadError: Could not load submarine [subname]. The file may be corrupted.
infotexts.SubDoesntMatchError:
Your version of the submarine file [subname] does not match the server's version!
Your MD5 hash: [myhash]
Server's MD5 hash: [serverhash]
infotexts.DownloadSubQuestion: Do you want to download the file from the server host?
infotexts.AddSubToolTip: Places another submarine into the current submarine file. Can be used for adding things such as smaller vessels, escape pods or detachable sections into the main submarine.
infotexts.CharacterModeToolTip: Allows you to pick up and use items. Useful for things such as placing items inside closets, turning devices on/off and doing the wiring.
infotexts.WiringModeToolTip: Allows you to connect wires between items.
infotexts.GenerateWaypointsToolTip: AI controlled crew members require waypoints to navigate around the sub.
infotexts.SubNameMissingWarning: Name your submarine before saving it.
infotexts.NoHullsWarning: No hulls found in the submarine. Hulls determine the "borders" of an individual room and are required for water and air distribution to work correctly.
infotexts.DisconnectedVentsWarning: The submarine contains vents which haven't been linked to an oxygen generator. Select a vent and click an oxygen generator while holding space to link them.
infotexts.NoWaypointsWarning: No waypoints found in the submarine. AI controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints.
infotexts.NoCargoSpawnpointWarning: "The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its "spawn type" parameter to "cargo".
infotexts.FarAwayEntitiesWarning: One or more structures have been placed very far from the submarine. Show the structures?
infotexts.NoBallastTagsWarning: You should add the tag "ballast" to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine.
infotexts.NoHullNamesWarning: No names given to any of the hulls, using autogenerated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting things such as hull breaches.
infotexts.LinkWaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.IDCardDescriptionTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.IDCardTagsTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.SpawnpointJobsTooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.ReloadLinkedSubTooltip: Reload the linked submarine from the specified file
infotexts.LinkLinkedSub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.SpamFilterKicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.SpamFilterBlocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.TraitorStartMessage: You are the Traitor! Your secret task is to assassinate [targetname]! Discretion is an utmost concern; sinking the submarine and killing the entire crew will arouse suspicion amongst the Fleet. If possible, make the death look like an accident.
infotexts.TraitorMoreAgentsMessage:
It is possible that there are other agents on this submarine. You don't know their names, but you do have a method of communication. Use the code words to greet the agent and code response to respond. Disguise such words in a normal-looking phrase so the crew doesn't suspect anything.

The code words are: [codewords].
The code response is: [coderesponse].
infotexts.TraitorStartMessageServer: [traitorname] is the traitor and the target is [targetname].
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccess: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor did not make it out alive either.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor was succesfully detained.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailure: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was unsuccessful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname], but [genderpronoun] got [genderpronounreflexive] killed before completing it.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task failed - [genderpronoun] was successfully detained.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.
infotexts.GiveInHelpMultiplayer: Let go of your character and enter spectator mode (other players will no longer be able to revive you)
infotexts.GiveInHelpSingleplayer: "The character can no longer be revived if you give in."
infotexts.DialogReactorFuel: Loading more fuel to the reactor!
infotexts.DialogLeakFixed: Repairing [roomname], a few more holes to go!
infotexts.DialogGetDivingGear: Need to find a diving suit!
infotexts.DialogGetOxygenTank: Need to find an oxygen tank!
infotexts.HuskDormant: It feels as if something was stuck in your throat
infotexts.HuskCantSpeak: You feel something moving in your throat. You try to scream but no sound comes out.
infotexts.HuskActivate: A strange chitinous appendage bursts out from your mouth. Use it to inject eggs into a living body by pressing [Attack]!
